item.title: GOP megabill poised to change the way Americans borrow and repay student loans
item.description: If the domestic-policy bill passes, repayment plans and borrowing limits on some types of loans will change.

item.title: ‘Finance makes me break out in hives’: I inherited $240K from my parents. Do I pay off my $258K mortgage and give up my job?
item.description: “I inherited $240K. Do I pay off my $258K mortgage and downsize my house and job?”

item.title: I was married twice. Can I switch from my Social Security benefit to my ex-husband’s when he dies?
item.description: “I started collecting my own Social Security benefits at age 70.”

item.title: How Robinhood’s dive into stock tokens makes it a ‘must own’ crypto investment, analysts say
item.description: The financial-services platform is making a smart move by getting deeper into cryptocurrencies, analysts say, as it will expand its customer base.

item.title: U.S. job openings climb to 6-month high. That’s the good news. The bad? Businesses aren’t hiring very quickly.
item.description: Job openings climbed in May to a six-month high as lots of graduates entered the labor force, but companies were not very quick to hire as the grapple...
